page.title: 13Buildings in Lockerley(cont)
page.content: Thatch is not so plentiful and cheap today because the combine harvesters do not leave good long lengths of straw. Duncan's House is opposite the King's Arms and it used to be an old smithy. It has two storeys with brick and some timber framing. It has a thatched roof. The Kings Arms is the only pub in the village of Lockerley. It has two storeys and is made of brick with a hipped roof which is tiled. The pub sign has a lion and a unicorn holding up the King's coat of arms. It is on a background of blue, the lion is gold and the unicorn is white. They both have crowns. Monday 8th July- roofing survey: 93 houses tiled; 47 slate; 14 cottages thatched; 10 blocks of flats tiled; 21 bungalows were tiled and 6 had slates. Most houses were brick, 1 weatherbo'd.
